com.forgerock.opendj.cli

Class MultiColumnPrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.forgerock.opendj.cli.MultiColumnPrinter

  • public final class MultiColumnPrinter
extends Object
    Utility class for printing columns of data.

    This printer can be used to print data in formatted table or in csv format.

    Regarding the formatting table feature, this class allows you to specify for each MultiColumnPrinter.Columns:

    • A unique identifier
    • The column title which will be printed by a call to printTitleLine()
    • The size (if a cell's data is bigger than the predefined size, then the data will not be truncated, i.e. it will overflow)
    • The number of digits to keep (for Double data)

    Code to write data is independent of the MultiColumnPrinter configuration: 

     void printData(final MultiColumnPrinter printer) {
     String[][] myData = new String[][] {
         new String[]{"U.S.A", "34.2", "40.8", ".us"},
         new String[]{"United Kingdom", "261.1", "31.6", ".uk"},
         new String[]{"France", "98.8", "30.1", ".fr"}
     };

     int i;
     for (String[] countryData : myData) {
         i = 0;
         for (final MultiColumnPrinter.Column column : printer.getColumns()) {
             printer.printData(countryData[i++]);
         }
     }
  }

    The following code sample presents how to create a MultiColumnPrinter to write CSV data: 

     final List columns = new ArrayList<>();
 columns.add(MultiColumnPrinter.column("CountryNameColumnId", "country_name", 0));
 columns.add(MultiColumnPrinter.column("populationDensityId", "population_density", 1));
 columns.add(MultiColumnPrinter.column("GiniId", "gini", 1));
 columns.add(MultiColumnPrinter.column("internetTLDId", "internet_tld", 0));
 MultiColumnPrinter myCsvPrinter = MultiColumnPrinter.builder(System.out, columns)
                                                     .columnSeparator(",")
                                                     .build();
 printData(myCsvPrinter);

    The code above would print: 

     country_name,population_density,gini,internet_tld
 U.S.A,34.2,40.8,.us
 United Kingdom,261.1,31.6,.uk
 France,98.8,30.1,.fr

    The following code sample presents how to configure a MultiColumnPrinter to print the same data on console with some title headers. 

         final List columns = new ArrayList<>();
     columns.add(MultiColumnPrinter.separatorColumn());
     columns.add(MultiColumnPrinter.column("CountryNameColumnId", "Country Name", 15, 0));
     columns.add(MultiColumnPrinter.column("populationDensityId", "Density", 10, 1));
     columns.add(MultiColumnPrinter.separatorColumn());
     columns.add(MultiColumnPrinter.column("GiniID", "GINI", 5, 1));
     columns.add(MultiColumnPrinter.column("internetTLDID", "TLD", 5, 0));
     columns.add(MultiColumnPrinter.separatorColumn());
     MultiColumnPrinter myPrinter = MultiColumnPrinter.builder(System.out, columns)
                                                      .format(true)
                                                      .columnSeparator("  ")
                                                      .titleAlignment(MultiColumnPrinter.Alignment.CENTER)
                                                      .build();
     myPrinter.printDashedLine();
     myPrinter.printTitleSection("General Information", 2);
     myPrinter.printTitleSection("Data", 2);
     myPrinter.printTitleLine();
     myPrinter.printDashedLine();
     printData(myPrinter);
     myPrinter.printDashedLine();

    The code above would print: 

     --------------------------------------------------
 |       General Information     |       Data     |
 |     Country Name     Density  |   GINI    TLD  |
 --------------------------------------------------
 |            U.S.A        34.2  |   40.8    .us  |
 |   United Kingdom       261.1  |   31.6    .uk  |
 |           France        98.8  |   30.1    .fr  |
 --------------------------------------------------

    • Method Detail

      • separatorColumn

        public static MultiColumnPrinter.Column separatorColumn()
        Returns a new separator MultiColumnPrinter.Column.

        This kind of MultiColumnPrinter.Column can be used to separate data sections.

        Returns:
        A new separator MultiColumnPrinter.Column.

      • column

        public static MultiColumnPrinter.Column column(String id,
                                               String title,
                                               int doublePrecision)
        Creates a new MultiColumnPrinter.Column with the provided arguments.
        Parameters:
        id - The column identifier.
        title - The column title.
        doublePrecision - The double precision used to print Double data for this column. See printData(Double).
        Returns:
        A new Column with the provided arguments.

      • column

        public static MultiColumnPrinter.Column column(String id,
                                               String title,
                                               int width,
                                               int doublePrecision)
        Creates a new Column with the provided arguments.
        Parameters:
        id - The column identifier.
        title - The column title.
        width - The column width. This information will only be used if the associated MultiColumnPrinter is configured to apply formatting. See MultiColumnPrinter.Builder.format(boolean).
        doublePrecision - The double precision to use to print data for this column.
        Returns:
        A new Column with the provided arguments.

      • builder

        public static MultiColumnPrinter.Builder builder(PrintStream stream,
                                                 List<MultiColumnPrinter.Column> columns)
        Creates a new MultiColumnPrinter.Builder to build a MultiColumnPrinter.
        Parameters:
        stream - The PrintStream to use to print data.
        columns - The List of MultiColumnPrinter.Column data to print.
        Returns:
        A new MultiColumnPrinter.Builder to build a MultiColumnPrinter.

      • printDashedLine

        public void printDashedLine()
        Prints a dashed line.

      • printTitleSection

        public void printTitleSection(String data,
                              int rowSpan)
        Formats and prints the provided text data. Merge the provided text over the provided number of column.

        Separator columns between merged columns will not be printed.

        Parameters:
        data - The section title to print.
        rowSpan - Specifies the number of rows a cell should span.

      • printTitleLine

        public void printTitleLine()
        Prints a line with all column title and separator.

      • printData

        public void printData(Double value)
        Prints the provided Double value on the current column.

        If this MultiColumnPrinter is configured to apply formatting, the provided value will be truncated according to the decimal precision set in the corresponding MultiColumnPrinter.Column.
        See column(String, String, int, int) for more details.

        Parameters:
        value - The double value to print.

      • printData

        public void printData(String data)
        Prints the provided text data on the current column.
        Parameters:
        data - The text data to print.

      • getColumns

        public List<MultiColumnPrinter.Column> getColumns()
        Returns the data MultiColumnPrinter.Column list of this MultiColumnPrinter.

        Separator columns are filtered out.

        Returns:
        The MultiColumnPrinter.Column list of this MultiColumnPrinter.
